task.title: Link from one topic to another
task.shortdesc: Links are very distracting to readers. The key is to insert a link only when absolutely required to keep them to a minimum. Then readers will know that it is not just tangentially relevant information but really important information.

taskbody.prereq: Both topics should be located on a file server or CMS before you can create a link between them. It is possible to link between topics that are not on a file server or CMS but it is not recommended.

context.p: A link from one topic to another lets you connect information from one topic to another. This, in turns, lets a reader find associated information without overloading any one particular topic with too much information.

step.cmd: Open the topic you want to create a link to.
Right-click on the content you want to link to.
Select Choose Link Target and then select the content you want to link to.
step.info: Usually, you link to a section, step, or paragraph. If you want to link to the entire topic, select the topic type (task, concept, or reference).

step.cmd: Following the prompts, press CTRL + C to copy the link information.
Open the topic in which you want to place the link.
step.info: This is the source topic. It contains the clickable link.

step.cmd: Put cursor where you want to create link.
Type some appropriate text for the link and select this text.
Press CTRL + V to paste your link.

taskbody.result: When the content is published, the link text automatically changes to the title of the topic or section that you are linking to.
